author: Miri Marshall
title: Extreme heat in DMV Friday | wusa9.com
text: WASHINGTON — Weather Impact Alert Details: What: - High heat and humidity. Highs: 94 - 99. Heat Index: Up to 110 degrees - Scattered strong to severe thunderstorms When: - Friday 12 p.m. until 8 p.m. for heat. - Friday 5 p.m. - 11 p.m. for storms. Impact: - Heat related illness possible - Some outdoor plans may have to be moved indoors Need to Know: - Reconsider outdoor activities - Drink plenty of non-sugary, non-alcoholic beverages -- preferably water - Check on elderly people, children and pets - Know the signs of heat related illnesses - Don't walk pets on the pavement - Close your shades or curtains The [WUSA9 Weather Team](/article/weather/forecast/weather-forecast-dmv/65-f729a838-1067-401b-a864-3c1cbb341b72) has issued a Weather Impact Alert for dangerous heat Friday and a chance for showers and storms. An Excessive Heat Warning will go into effect for the District and I-95 Corridor and points southeast, with a Heat Advisory for most of the DMV until 8 p.m. Heat and humidity combined will make it feel much hotter than the actual air temperature. The heat index could make it feel as hot as 110 degrees in some areas. In addition to the heat, there is a chance for showers and storms, anytime between 5 p.m. - 11 p.m. There is a small chance for one or two of the storms to become strong to severe, producing strong gusty winds. Some storms may also produce heavy rain, which could make it difficult to see while driving or lead to water ponding on the roads. Storms will be spaced out, so not everyone will see a storm. WUSA9 issues Weather Impact alert for dangerous or deadly weather, or even non-severe weather that may cause you to change your plans. It's our commitment to keeping our community safe.
